00155     enum {
00156         /*
00157          * @brief The item view type returned by {@link Adapter#getItemViewType(int)} 
00158          * when the provider does not want the item's view recycled.
00159          */
00160         ITEM_VIEW_TYPE_IGNORE = -1,
00161 
00162         /*
00163          * @brief The item view type returned by {@link Adapter#getItemViewType(int)} 
00164          * when the item is a header or footer.
00165          */
00166         ITEM_VIEW_TYPE_HEADER_OR_FOOTER = -2,
00167 
00168         /*
00169          * @brief Sync based on the selected child
00170          */
00171         SYNC_SELECTED_POSITION = 0,
00172 
00173         /*
00174          * @brief Sync based on the first child displayed
00175          */
00176         SYNC_FIRST_POSITION = 1,
00177 
00178         /*
00179          * @brief Maximum amount of time to spend in {@link #findSyncPosition()}
00180          */
00181         SYNC_MAX_DURATION_MILLIS = 100,
00182 
00183         /*
00184          * @brief Represents an invalid position. All valid positions are in the range 0 to 1 less than the
00185          * number of items in the current provider.
00186          */
00187         INVALID_POSITION = -1,
00188 
00189         /*
00190          * @brief Represents an empty or invalid row id
00191          */
00192         INVALID_ROW_ID = LLONG_MIN,
00193 
00197         INVALID_COLUMN_ID = LLONG_MIN
00198     };

00686     /*
00687      * Smoothly scroll to the specified adapter position. The view will scroll
00688      * such that the indicated position is displayed <code>offset</code> pixels
00689      * from the top edge of the view. If this is impossible,  (e.g. the offset
00690      * would scroll the first or last item beyond the boundaries of the list) it
00691      * will get as close as possible. The scroll will take <code>duration</code>
00692      * milliseconds to complete.
00693      *
00694      * @param position Position to scroll to
00695      * @param offset Desired distance in pixels of <code>position</code> from
00696      * the top of the view when scrolling is finished
00697      * @param duration Number of milliseconds to use for the scroll
00698      *
00699      */
00700     void smoothScrollToPositionFromTop(int position, int offset, int duration);
00701 
00702      /*
00703       * Smoothly scroll to the specified adapter position. The view will scroll
00704       * such that the indicated position is displayed <code>offset</code> pixels
00705       * from the top edge of the view. If this is impossible,  (e.g. the offset
00706       * would scroll the first or last item beyond the boundaries of the list)
00707       * it will get as close as possible.
00708       *
00709       * @param position Position to scroll to
00710       * @param offset Desired distance in pixels of <code>position</code> from
00711       * the top of the view when scrolling is finished
00712       **/
00713     void smoothScrollToPositionFromTop(int position, int offset);

01031     /* @brief Get the position within the provider's data set for the Widget, where Widget is a an provider item
01032      * or a descendant of an provider item.
01033      *
01034      * @param Widget an provider item, or a descendant of an provider item. This must be visible in this
01035      *        AbsListWidget at the time of the call.
01036      * @return the position within the provider's data set of the Widget, or {@link #INVALID_POSITION}
01037      *         if the Widget does not correspond to a list item (or it is not currently visible).
01038      */

01046      */

01048 
01049     /* @brief Returns the position within the provider's data set for the last item

01051      *
01052      * @return The position within the provider's data set
01053      */
01054     virtual int32_t getLastVisiblePosition();
01055 
01056     /* @brief Searches the provider for a position matching mSyncRowId. The search starts at mSyncPosition
01057      * and then alternates between moving up and moving down until 1) we find the right position, or
01058      * 2) we run out of time, or 3) we have looked at every position
01059      *
01060      * @return Position of the row that matches mSyncRowId, or {@link #INVALID_POSITION} if it can't
01061      *          be found
01062      */
01063     virtual int32_t findSyncPosition();
01064 
01065     /* @brief Find a position that can be selected (i.e., is not a separator).
01066      *
01067      * @param position The starting position to look at.
01068      * @param lookDown Whether to look down for other positions.
01069      * @return The next selectable position starting at position and then
01070      * searching either up or
01071      *         down. Returns {@link #INVALID_POSITION} if nothing can be found.
01072      */
01073     virtual int32_t lookForSelectablePosition(int32_t position, bool);
01074 
01075     /* @brief Call the OnItemClickListener, if it is defined.

01081      *         called, false otherwise is returned.
01082      */

01343 /* @class ListWidgetOnItemClickListener
01344  * Interface definition for a callback to be invoked when an item in this
01345  * providerView has been clicked.
01346  */
01347 class OnItemClickListenerProxy;
01348 class ListWidgetOnItemClickListener {
01349   public:
01350     ListWidgetOnItemClickListener();
01351     virtual ~ListWidgetOnItemClickListener();
01352 
01353     /*
01354      * Callback method to be invoked when an item in this providerView has
01355      * been clicked.
01356      * <p>
01357      * Implementers can call getItemAtPosition(position) if they need
01358      * to access the data associated with the selected item.
01359      *
01360      * @param parent The providerView where the click happened.
01361      * @param view The view within the providerView that was clicked (this
01362      *            will be a view provided by the provider)
01363      * @param position The position of the view in the provider.
01364      * @param id The row id of the item that was clicked.
01365      */
01366     virtual void onItemClick(gaia::ui::AbsListWidget *pParent,
01367         gaia::core::Widget *pWidget, int32_t position, int64_t id) = 0;
01368 
01369     OnItemClickListenerProxy *getProxy() const;
01370 
01371   private:
01372     OnItemClickListenerProxy *mpProxy;
01373     DISALLOW_COPY_AND_ASSIGN(ListWidgetOnItemClickListener);
01374 };
01375 
01376 /*Interface definition for a callback to be invoked when an item in this
01377  * view has been clicked and held.
01378  */
01379 class OnItemLongClickListenerProxy;
01380 class ListWidgetOnItemLongClickListener {
01381   public:
01382     ListWidgetOnItemLongClickListener();
01383     virtual ~ListWidgetOnItemLongClickListener();
01384 
01385     /*Callback method to be invoked when an item in this view has been
01386      * clicked and held.
01387      *
01388      * Implementers can call getItemAtPosition(position) if they need to access
01389      * the data associated with the selected item.
01390      *
01391      * @param parent The AbsListView where the click happened
01392      * @param view The view within the AbsListView that was clicked
01393      * @param position The position of the view in the list
01394      * @param id The row id of the item that was clicked
01395      *
01396      * @return true if the callback consumed the long click, false otherwise
01397      */
01398     virtual bool onItemLongClick(gaia::ui::AbsListWidget *parent,
01399             gaia::core::Widget *view, int32_t position, int64_t id) = 0;
01400 
01401     gaia::ui::OnItemLongClickListenerProxy *getProxy() const;
01402 
01403   private:
01404     gaia::ui::OnItemLongClickListenerProxy *mpProxy;
01405     DISALLOW_COPY_AND_ASSIGN(ListWidgetOnItemLongClickListener);
01406 };
01407 
01408 /*
01409  *Interface definition for a callback to be invoked when
01410  * an item in this view has been selected.
01411  */
01412 class OnItemSelectedListenerProxy;
01413 class ListWidgetOnItemSelectedListener {
01414   public:
01415     ListWidgetOnItemSelectedListener();
01416     virtual ~ListWidgetOnItemSelectedListener();
01417     /* @brief Callback method to be invoked when an item in this view has been
01418      * selected.
01419      *
01420      * Impelmenters can call getItemAtPosition(position) if they need to access the
01421      * data associated with the selected item.
01422      *
01423      * @param parent The providerView where the selection happened
01424      * @param view The view within the providerView that was clicked
01425      * @param position The position of the view in the provider
01426      * @param id The row id of the item that is selected
01427      */
01428     virtual void onItemSelected(gaia::ui::AbsListWidget *parent,
01429             gaia::core::Widget *view, int32_t position, int64_t id) = 0;
01430 
01431     /* @brief Callback method to be invoked when the selection disappears from this
01432      * view. The selection can disappear for instance when touch is activated
01433      * or when the provider becomes empty.
01434      *
01435      * @param parent The providerView that now contains no selected item.
01436      */
01437     virtual void onNothingSelected(gaia::ui::AbsListWidget *parent) = 0;
01438 
01439     gaia::ui::OnItemSelectedListenerProxy *getProxy() const;
01440 
01441   private:
01442     gaia::ui::OnItemSelectedListenerProxy *mpProxy;
01443     DISALLOW_COPY_AND_ASSIGN(ListWidgetOnItemSelectedListener);
01444 };
01445 };  // for namespace ui
01446 };  // for namespace gaia
